titleStmt.title: The despairing lover. Whose mind with sorrow much was discontented, because of his true love he was prevented. To the tune of, Aim not too high.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by and for W.O. for A.M., to be sold by J. Deacon,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Break heart and dye, I may no longer live ..."
In two parts, separated for mounting; part 2 has caption title: A constant and kind maid.
Imperfect: trimmed, affecting imprint and text.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
